Warranty of the product is limited to only manufacturing defect on camera body & lens.
2 years Nikon India Warranty and Free Transit Insurance.
Customer needs to carry the product to the nearby Authorized Service Center to get the product repaired or inspected.

Nikon Service Warranty (Local Warranty) does not apply to any of the followings:- Defects or malfunctions caused by damage resulting from improper care, misuse or abuse of this product or operation of this product contrary to the instructions contained in the owner's manual. Damage or defect caused by accident, sand, water or battery leakage. Damage caused during transportation or mail. Damaged caused by any modifications or servicing performed by person(s) other than NIKON AUTHORISED SERVICE FACILITY. Accessories including batteries, charger, AC adaptor and other consumables. Any electronic data loss due to malfunctioning or repair of this product. Any consequential or incidental damages resulting from any breach of warranty, express or implied, applicable to this product. Nikon India New Extended Service Warranty (Local Warranty) does not apply to any of the followings:- Accessories like batteries, charger, USB cable, AV cable, Adapters, strap, etc. are not covered under warranty. Damage caused due to accident, sand, water, dust, fungus, battery leakage, etc are not covered under warranty. Warranty on free gifts is as per the terms of their respective manufactures, and this warranty does not extend to such gifts. Warranty does not cover the replacement of Product. Warranty does not cover any special, consequential or incidental damages arising in way due to malfunction of the Product such as loss of photography, loss of data, use, profits, or costs and expenses, etc.
The right body. The wrong Lens

The body D5100 is amongst the best a beginner could get. But not the LENS.1. D5100 PROS : i) Decent Low Light Performance ii) 11 focus points with 1 cross type (again, its sufficient) iii) Ergonomic Design and easy to carry/hold. iv) Flip Screen (much needed while shooting videos) CONS : i) Has NEF Compression (not good if you are an astrophotographer) ii) The colours appear mostly neutral and sometimes a bit under-saturated, unlike the canon options. (Maybe good / bad, varies on personal opinion) iii) A bit under performing than the D5200/D5300, they being a bit costlier may seem to be better options to invest in(D5100:if you are hard on budget)2. LENS : Tamron 18-200 f3.5-6.3 Di II (Aspherical) PROS : i) The Aspherical Optics - Hence an internal focus system. ii) The range of the complete kit lens + that added telephoto range iii) Good for almost all purposes ( Landscapes/Portraits/Stage ) CONS : i) A very slow aperture ( min. f3.5 @18mm and f6.3 @200 mm ) ii) Slow and Noisy focus motor (Not good for videos at all) iii) Tight Zoom Ring (Its very rigid) iv) Below Average performance when compared to the nikon counterparts v) No Manual override mode for auto focus vi) A bit heavySome of the better options for the lens at this pricing point are : 1. The KIT Lens (18-55mm f/3.5-f/5.6) with VR II (Vibration Reduction) {A decent lens} 2. Nikon Nikkor 55-200 mm with VR ( Not advisable for lanscapes ) 3. Nikon 35mm f/1.8g DX ( Good for street photography and potraits ) 4. Nikon 50mm f/1.8g DXIf you can have a budget of upto 30k for the lens try going for TAMRON 17-50mm f/2.8 (Without the VC~26k , with VC ~ 32k)Its the best replacement for the kit lens , since it gives you a fixed f/2.8 aperture all along the zoom length and has a very fast focus performance and also a brilliant colour reproduction.
